Comment: Aetna is the sole insurance company on my state's Marketplace that covers the best hospital network in my area. I've been on Marketplace coverage since I went on disability from my job, and chose Aetna specifically because I wanted to see doctors in that network. Now, I have to hope they can negotiate coverage from another carrier next year, because the only other options are Catholic hospital networks, and being a trans person that means that I'd have severely-limited care options. It really sucks.

Comment: Health insurance shedding business because ultimately the deep secret of health insurance is that it’s not that profitable. Companies have been exiting FFS and individual plans; exiting the ACA is just another pruning of the low profit/no profit business. There is a reason Walgreens wrote off the VillageMD acquisition. The current market, is really only profitable if a company has a Medicare Advantage plan that is essentially a government subsidy.   If the government gets serious about MA fraud, waste, and abuse, the whole system could come crashing down.

Comment: The ACA has been an amazing success. Could it be better? Sure. But it has solved a lot of issues with healthcare in the United States and brought affordable insurance to millions of Americans.   It's biggest fault is that Medicaid expansion was not made mandatory, leaving a lot of low-wage workers in red States without insurance, just out of spite since the federal government was picking up the tab.  Calling it a failure indicates either an amazing lack of understanding or a pretty cynical agenda.
